title: Microsoft's Strategic Alliances With Nvidia and Nintendo: A Winning Move?
text: Can Microsoft's new partnerships help ease regulators' minds on the Activision acquisition?

title: Nvidia is now on board with Microsoft-Activision deal: here's what changed
text: Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ: MSFT) just promised to bring its Xbox PC games to Nvidia Corporation's (NASDAQ: NVDA) cloud gaming service. Shares ended more than 2.0% down on Tuesday.

title: Microsoft and Nvidia Just Struck a Gaming Deal. What It Means for NVDA Stock.
text: Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA ) has been enjoying an excellent month, with NVDA stock up more than 7%. The new artificial intelligence (AI) boom has trigged a rush on tech companies in the space.

title: Nvidia's AI potential is substantial but may not be enough to sidestep the downtick in IT spending, analysts say
text: NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA) is set to benefit from the proliferation of artificial intelligence (AI) according to Wedbush Securities, but analysts there are less certain the chip-maker can sidestep the decline in overall IT spending when it reports its fourth quarter earnings for fiscal 2023 after the bell on Wednesday. In a note to clients, the analysts wrote that they expect AI to benefit the larger semiconductor complex, particularly Nvidia given the dominant position it has established within the data center market.

title: Nvidia earnings overshadowed by Microsoft, ChatGPT, OpenAI, 10-year gaming partnership
text: Nvidia Corp. earnings received a warmup Tuesday as Microsoft Corp. and the graphics-processing-unit giant announced a 10-year partnership to bring Activision Blizzard Inc.'s catalog as well as Xbox games to Nvidia's cloud gaming service GeForce Now.

title: Week Ahead: Retail Earnings, Berkshire Hathaway, and Time to Buy Nvidia Stock?
text: With earnings from retail leaders such as Walmart, and Target, as well as chip giant Nvidia, we will be getting significant insight into the underlying economy

title: Microsoft to Bring Xbox PC Games to Nvidia's GeForce Now
text: Subscribers to Nvidia's service will get more games to play wherever they go.

title: Microsoft teams up with Nvidia and Nintendo in 10-year deal to stream Xbox games
text: Microsoft Corp. has signed a 10-year deal to bring Xbox and other properties to Nvidia Corp.'s cloud gamers and to Nintendo Co.'s gamers in a push to satisfy antitrust regulators about its pending $69 billion acquisition of videogame publisher Activision Blizzard Inc.

title: This Iron Condor Idea Has A Potential Return Of 69% For NVDA Stock
text: The iron condor is a common option trade used ahead of earnings. The post This Iron Condor Idea Has A Potential Return Of 69% For NVDA Stock appeared first on Investor's Business Daily.

title: Microsoft and NVIDIA announce expansive new gaming deal
text: Partnership will bring blockbuster lineup of Xbox games, including Minecraft and Activision titles like Call of Duty, to NVIDIA GeForce NOW cloud gaming service

title: Microsoft president says he has Activision licensing deal with Nvidia
text: Microsoft President Brad Smith said on Tuesday the U.S. software giant has agreed to a licensing deal that will bring Activision games to Nvidia's gaming platform and hoped that rival Sony will consider doing the same.

title: Is Cathie Wood Giving Up on Nvidia (NVDA) Stock?
text: Cathie Wood's Ark Invest has been one of the most controversial tech stock bellwethers on the market. The investment firm and Wood herself have experienced significant criticism in 2022.

title: When Will ChatGPT, Artificial Intelligence Drive Nvidia Sales?
text: Nvidia has gotten a boost lately from companies ramping up artificial intelligence initiatives using the chipmaker's processors. The post When Will ChatGPT, Artificial Intelligence Drive Nvidia Sales?

title: Which ‘MATANA' Stocks Have the Most Upside?
text: Not to be confused with the hit song from ‘The Lion King,' MATANA is the latest term to describe the market's technology leaders. The catchy sextet (in order) consists of Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL), Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA), Alphabet (NASDAQ: GOOG), Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA)  and Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN).

title: Nvidia: Q4 Earnings Expected To Fall 60%
text: NVIDIA is set to release its earnings tomorrow. Analysts expect NVDA to bring in $0.47 in earnings per share, down 60% from a year before.

title: Cathie Wood Is Selling This Top AI Stock. Should You?
text: The ARK Invest founder appears to think there are better AI opportunities right now.
